main event: An observer reported seeing a white spherical object moving at a fast rate of speed at an estimated altitude of 50,000 feet near Robins Air Force Base on 6 November 1957.
interesting points: The object was sighted for a brief period of about 2 minutes.,The observer described the object as climbing rapidly.,No noise was reported from the object.,The sighting involved a single object that appeared to be a bright star in motion.,The air traffic in the area was normal at the time of the sighting.
location: Robins Air Force Base, Georgia, United States
witness description: One observer was a 42-year-old male sales representative, and the other was a 65-year-old female housewife.
